result.description: asymmetric recursive union of all objects in `objects`, merged from left to right, where conflicts are resolved by choosing the key from the right-hand object

cases.note: withkeyword/function: simple scope handling (no recursion here)
modules:
package test

f(x) := 2

g(x) := f(x)

p := y if y := f(1) with f as g

cases.note: withkeyword/function: direct call, arity 1, replacement is value that needs eval (array comprehension)
withkeyword/function: indirect call, arity 1, replacement is value that needs eval (array comprehension)
withkeyword/function: indirect call, arity 1, replacement is local variable
modules:
package test
f(1) = 2
p if {
  my_var := 1
  q with f as my_var
}
q if r
r if f(1) == 1

cases.note: withkeyword/function: indirect call, arity 1, replacement is local variable via scan
modules:
package test
f(1) = 2
p if {
  some v in numbers.range(1, 10)
  q with f as v
}
q if r
r if f(1) == 10

cases.note: withkeyword/function: indirect call, arity 1, multiple, nested replacements
